name: mechanical treatment facility construction, waste electric and electronic equipment | mechanical treatment facility, waste electric and electronic equipment | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4322/documentation

The functional unit represents a site for the mechanical treatment of WEEE devices (including the preceding manual depollution step), with all the necessary facilities. Process data based on own estimations, using proper experiences within the Swiss e-Waste systems. The here described plant has an assumed treatment capacity of 50â€™000 t per year over a time span of 25 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



This module includes land use, buildings and facilities (machinery, cables, etc.) as well as the respective disposal activities of a plant for mechanical WEEE treatment.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Waste Treatment & Recycling

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This module is based on experiences in Switzerland as a proxy for the global situation.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Modern mechanical treatment plant, based on information from literature & proper knowledge about companies in Switzerland
